title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: A nor'easter is expected to hit southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island Sunday night into Monday, with possible heavy snow and strong winds.
Meteorologists anticipate a high-impact storm with potential coastal flooding and power outages due to heavy, wet snow and wind.
Snowfall could reach over 12 inches in metro Boston and more than 6 inches in southeastern Massachusetts, with possible blizzard conditions.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to comment on Sam Kennedy's implication that he chose to leave the Red Sox.
Sam Kennedy claimed Bregman would've stayed if he wanted, drawing attention with Bregman's move to the Cubs.
Bregman emphasized that the Cubs' no-trade clause wasn't the sole reason for leaving, but did not disclose more.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now (Redux)' featuring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex, following the actor's recent passing.
'Blue Moon' by Richard Linklater, a biopic about lyricist Lorenz Hart starring Ethan Hawke, is available on Netflix.
Season 2 of 'The Last Thing He Told Me' starring Jennifer Garner is now streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must improve offensively to earn Opening Day roster spot.
Mayer batted .228 with a .674 OPS in 44 games last season, missed year-end due to a wrist injury.
Cora assessing Mayer at second and third base during spring training amidst competition for infield positions.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Southeastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island face high impact from possible heavy snow and winds from Sunday night to Monday.
Forecasters warn of potential coastal flooding and power outages from a nor'easter hitting late Sunday into Monday.
Snowfall estimates suggest one foot or more is possible on the South Shore, Cape Cod, and potentially metro Boston.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court for the first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her three children in 2023.
Clancy, accused of murder and strangulation, remained unexpressive and addressed the judge only once during the hearing.
Her defense claims she was heavily medicated and experiencing auditory hallucinations before the alleged killings.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County approved a transfer fee on home sales over $1 million, expected to raise $60 million annually for housing.
The fee ranges from 0.5% to 4% on sales above $1 million and requires approval from the state legislature.
90% of the revenue will return to towns for housing initiatives, with potential exemptions for first-time buyers and retirees.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are on alert for a 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for Friday at 3 p.m.
Authorities coordinate with local and state agencies to ensure safety during the anticipated event.
Recent vehicle takeovers involve large crowds, causing disturbances like street blockades and car burnouts.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Harvard Street Gang face federal drug and firearms charges after coordinated searches in Eastern Massachusetts.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and cash from various locations connected to the Harvard Street Gang investigation.
The gang has been investigated since 2019, with charges related to drug trafficking, firearms offenses, and violent crimes.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics for Warriors citing reasons beyond basketball, hinting at personal motives.
The Celtics aimed to reduce salary under the luxury tax, influencing Horford's decision to leave.
Horford expressed admiration for Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla's leadership and team-building efforts.
